meanings.definition: To operate beyond the necessary or desired extent.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, I overoperate my computer by running too many programs at once.
meanings.sent2: It is not good to overoperate a machine beyond its limits.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally overoperate the TV remote and now it's stuck on a random channel.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm to help can sometimes overoperate, causing more confusion than clarity.
meanings.sent5: The chef warned us not to overoperate the blender, or it might break.

meanings.definition: To work excessively or too much.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overoperate when I have a lot of tasks to complete in a short time.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overoperate, as it can lead to burnout.
meanings.sent3: He tends to overoperate on weekends, trying to finish all his chores at once.
meanings.sent4: The machine started to overoperate due to the constant high demand placed on it.
meanings.sent5: She realized she needed to take breaks to avoid overoperating and exhausting herself.
